</details>

---

#### Declarations diff

`+ instance [DecidableEq Î±] {s : Finset Î±} : Fintype (Finpartition s)`
<details>

ðŸš€ Pull request has been placed on the maintainer queue by YaelDillies.
This looks like it was ported from code I wrote in the Xena discord, without credit.

Thanks!

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10907292263/job/30270596900)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/10907292263/job/30270596512)

Nicely done!

maintainer merge

Nicely done!

maintainer merge

This looks exponentially bad in terms of runtime / term size. Can we use the list function that was posted [on Zulip](https://leanprover.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/217875-Is-there-code-for-X.3F/topic/all.20partitions.20of.20a.20list/near/455989656) which finds all partitions instead?
I know it is (doubly) exponentially bad, but where is the Zulip post?
Edited above with a link

The code in the Zulip link does not count the partitions I want. It merely takes in an ordered list and outputs all ways to put separators into it _preserving order_ â€“ and the count of this is $2^{n-1}$ for a length-n list, not the Bell numbers.

In particular the code given there only gives 16 "partitions" of a length-5 list. The 5th Bell number is 52.

Here's the right function:
```lean
private def insertAux (x : Î±) (l : List (List Î±)) : List (List (List Î±)) :=
  match l with
  | [] => [[[x]]]
  | y :: ys => ((x :: y) :: ys) :: (insertAux x ys).map (y :: Â·)

/-- Partitions of `l` into sublists. -/
def sublistPartitions (l : List Î±) : List (List (List Î±)) :=
  match l with
  | [] => [[]]
  | x :: xs => (sublistPartitions xs).bind fun p => insertAux x p
```
I've opened #16647 with this definition; I am happy for you to try and solve the sorries there if you want to!

I agree there's scope to improve the runtime of this definition, but let's get this current one merged while the details of the faster one are figured out? If I recall correctly, it's also difficult to show this function descends correctly to an operation on `Finset`s. Let's add a TODO in the file to your PR as well, so it's recorded.
Agreed, a TODO is enough to unblock this PR.
Done.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: `Fintype (Finpartition s)` for `s : Finset Î±`
